result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Todd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs, Buy Money and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Buy Money to be paid to Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

sent to prison
Certificates filed by Attorney Rosario.

Defendant Nicholas J Todd in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

6 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - TO BE DETERMINED -  ATTORNEY'S TO FILE REQUEST WITH THE COURT) (consecuitve to 15CF809) to begin forthwith.
  -  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
*100 hours community service. 
*Anger Management Counseling. 

ANY OUTSTANDING COURT COSTS/FINES : TO BE CONVERTED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.


Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. (after two years initial confinement)
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program. (after two years initial confinement)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas J Todd in court with attorney Michael Hart.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6 dismissed and read-in. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Sentence withheld for 4 years Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Buy Money of $180.00 to be paid to Metro Drug Unit to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s.  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia.   DNA Sample if not yet provided
 -  One (1) year jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing forthwith. 1st 10 months straight time, last 2 months with huber. Credit for 192 days.
